title: Transparency obligations for providers and deployers of certain AI systems and general-purpose AI models

obligations.requirement: Providers of AI systems, including general-purpose AI systems, generating synthetic audio, image, video or text content, shall ensure that the outputs of the AI system are marked in a machine-readable format and detectable as artificially generated or manipulated.
obligations.what_to_do: Display clear disclosure that user is interacting with an AI system
exceptions: AI systems authorized by law for the purpose of detecting, preventing, investigating and prosecuting criminal offences
AI systems where it is obvious from the circumstances and the context of use that the user is interacting with an AI system

obligations.requirement: Providers shall mark synthetic content (image, audio, video, text) in a machine-readable format
obligations.what_to_do: Add machine-readable watermarks (C2PA/IPTC) to all AI-generated content
exceptions: AI systems performing assistive functions (e.g., spell check, formatting)
AI systems performing standard editing unless substantially altering content

obligations.requirement: Deployers of emotion recognition systems or biometric categorisation systems shall inform natural persons of the operation of the system
obligations.what_to_do: Display clear disclosure before system activates emotion recognition

obligations.requirement: Deployers of AI systems that generate or manipulate image, audio or video content constituting a deep fake, shall disclose that the content has been artificially generated or manipulated
obligations.what_to_do: Add prominent, clear and distinguishable disclosure that content is deepfake
exceptions: Content necessary for exercise of freedom of the arts and freedom of the sciences
Content constituting parody or similar artistic work
Content with full editorial responsibility and compliance with journalistic standards

label_requirements.distinguishability: Must be easily distinguishable from normal content

obligations.requirement: AI-generated text published to inform the public on matters of public interest must be labeled as artificially generated
obligations.what_to_do: Add disclosure to AI-generated news articles and public interest content
exceptions: Text that has undergone human review and editorial responsibility is exercised by a natural person

penalties.non_compliance: Up to â‚¬15,000,000 or 3% of global annual turnover
penalties.enforcement_authority: National competent authorities in each EU member state

key_definitions.provider: Natural or legal person that develops or has an AI system developed with a view to placing it on the market or putting it into service under its own name or trademark
key_definitions.deployer: Natural or legal person using an AI system under its authority
key_definitions.deep_fake: AI-generated or manipulated image, audio or video content that resembles existing persons, objects, places or other entities or events
key_definitions.synthetic_content: Content that has been artificially generated by an AI system
